title: Simply Guacamole Recipe
description: This is so easy and so good. It's always the hit of the party and it's gone before anything else on the table.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Guacamole Recipes Simply Guacamole 4.7 (78) 64 Reviews 15 Photos This is so easy and so good. It's always the hit of the party and it's gone before anything else on the table. Submitted by Paulina Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 15 15 15 15 Prep Time: 25 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 20 Yield: 5 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings 5 avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice ¾ cup minced green onion ½ cup minced fresh cilantro salt and pepper, to taste Directions Stir together the avocado and lemon juice in a serving bowl; add the green onion and cilantro; mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or store covered in refrigerator with avocado pits in the bowl to keep from browning. I Made It Print 170 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 82 Calories 7g Fat 5g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 20 Calories 82 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 1g 6% Sodium 5mg 0% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 1g Protein 1g 2% Vitamin C 7mg 7% Calcium 10mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 262mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Simply Guacamole 01 of 15 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 15 Photo by  Buckwheat Queen 11/01/2020 Simply delicious. I used limes instead of lemons, though. 03 of 15 Photo by  Banu 11/04/2019 I ran out of guacamole mix last minute and tried your recipe! Thanks for saving the day! Can’t have a puking pumpkin without guac!! 04 of 15 Photo by  Liz 01/01/2019 05 of 15 Photo by  Linda Eder 06/26/2017 06 of 15 Photo by  Linda Eder 06/26/2017 07 of 15 Photo by  Tammy Lynn 05/11/2016 Simple and tasty--perfect as a topping or dip. 08 of 15 Photo by  dlynne73 11/06/2015 09 of 15 Photo by  mommyluvs2cook 09/07/2012 It's exactly as the title says, simple! It's a nice quick version of my usual version, which requires more chopping, but for something fast, this works! 10 of 15 Photo by  Jamie Justice Yost 05/20/2012 All I did was add a tomato (it was about to go bad and I needed to use it) and lime juice instead of lemon. One word - YUM. Delicious and simple are always nice words to associate with a recipe and this one is a keeper! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Basic Guacamole Dip 39 Ratings Fresh Guacamole 70 Ratings Quick and Easy Guacamole 48 Ratings Creamy, Spicy Guacamole 11 Ratings Chipotle Guacamole 27 Ratings Mango-Tomatillo Guacamole 4 Ratings Best Guacamole 691 Ratings Traditional Mexican Guacamole 197 Ratings LuvAnn's Guacamole 281 Ratings Easy Never Forgotten Guacamole 182 Ratings Guacamole 7,630 Ratings My Grandma's Guacamole 6 Ratings Corn and Black Bean Guacamole 31 Ratings Holiday Guacamole 19 Ratings Guacamole with Nopales (Mexican Cactus) 2 Ratings Lite Brocamole 13 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Paulina
instructions: Stir together the avocado and lemon juice in a serving bowl; add the green onion and cilantro; mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or store covered in refrigerator with avocado pits in the bowl to keep from browning.
